desc: This course focuses on learning modern field and laboratory methods to test ecological hypotheses. Students work on group and individual projects to collect and analyze data and give oral and written presentations on projects. Class periods focus on discussion of primary literature and project results. Class trips include visits to local natural areas. Students attend lectures plus one 4-hour laboratory per week. Taught annually. GE: ORC. Prerequisites: Biology 125, 126, and 261.
notes: Students in Bio 371 must also register for discussion Bio 371D and lab Bio 371L.
title: Field Ecology
